intro: Pilea trinitensis, commonly known as the Trinitarian begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Begoniaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage is often variegated, featuring shades of green, white, and pink, which adds to its ornamental appeal. Pilea trinitensis thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
